channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Shades of Black
item.description: Patches for secret Air Force programs, annotated. "The phrase Oderint Dum Metuant is usually associated with Caligula... It translates as 'Let them hate so long as they fear.'"

item.title: Two Lives, Simultaneous and Perfect
item.description: On Rohmer. Invokes Bataille like Baudrillard reviews Santa Cruz: a nostalgia for the old prohibitions. Bataille does it better.

item.title: APIs are about Policy
item.description: APIs can be too basically about data; they need to enforce constraints (e.g. permissions, consistency)

item.title: What we learned (and can share) from passing our SOC 2 Type II audit
item.description: Good real-talk notes on SOC 2 dos/don'ts.

item.title: Simulation Games Might Be What The World Needs Now
item.description: Sim games are a window on complexity; people actually enjoy working with it. cc Morton.

item.title: What Happened Wasn't Fate at All
item.description: Grim dispatches from the civil war in Yemen. Remind me of the interview in "Lessons of Darkness."

item.title: The Great Regression
item.description: Adult retention of culture for kids as an adaptation to precarity and responsibility.

item.title: Elon Musk's Texts Shatter the Myth of the Tech Genius
Serving Static Files and Web Apps in Go
item.description: A good http builtin I didn't know, and a method for embedding static assets in built binaries.

item.title: Responsive Design
item.description: Interactive visualization of an adaptive side-by-side layout. Useful.

item.title: Regulating DAOs
item.description: Really it's the deep weird of regulating non-persons.
